result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Wayne Lewandowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham September 15, 2016 so ordered -  Total pre-sentence credit due is 5 days.

Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 2, 3 and 4.
Defendant to report to Probation today September 1, 2016.
Court authorizes transfer of Probation to Minnesota.
Court extends 10 days to determine credit for time served.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Harrelson gives sentencing recommendations. 

Court orders: Sentence W/H
2 1/2 years probation with conditions:
- 6 months conditional jail time  3 months STAYed.
  To be served in St. Croix County Jail with Huber and any sort of treatment. 
   to be served 1 month every year of probation. 
- $388.32 restitution to Hudson Fleet Farm
- Costs of $268.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.
  Apply bond on file. 
- 40 hours community service
- AODA at the direction of the agent.
- Maintain any mental health treatment 
- Participate in restorative justice
- MRT at the descretion of the agent.
- DE to testify truthfully at any trials of the co-DE. 
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Court authorized transfer of probation to MN. 
Court extends 10 days to determine credit for time served. 
DE to sign up for probation today.

Filed by Atty Harrelson. km
Atty Harrelson
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2015 at 10:45 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Fleet Farm in Hudson, Wi.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
